page.title: 20The area's major employer
page.content: Legal and General Assurance Company Limited has its main branch in Kingswood. It is a major employer in the area, having 870 managerial and administrative staff, 292 computer staff, 64 tradesmen and 1 nurse. The company was founded in 1836 when six members of the legal profession met in a coffee house in Fleet Street. It has now grown into Europe's largest pension office and second largest life assurance group. The main offices were built in the grounds of a girls' school called St.Monica's and are about to be demolished to make way for a new building which conforms more to the company's needs. The landscaping of the new building is designed to recreate the Victorian country house with most of the car parks enclosed in walled gardens. Accommodation will be on three levels, one below ground.
